intro: Klemachloa, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in panicles, typically blooming in spring. Klemachloa is well adapted to coastal environments and can thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often used in traditional Māori weaving and has cultural significance in New Zealand.
